DataElement.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Current Quality of Life Comparison to Prior Month Before Cancer Diagnosis 5 Point Rating Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of their health-related quality of life now as compared to one month before their cancer diagnosis, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Current Quality of Life Comparison to Prior Month Before Cancer Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness._The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences._Earlier in time or order._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Version 4
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Concepts.longName: University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Version 4
Concepts.definition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Property.preferredName: Current Quality of Life Comparison Prior Month Malignant Neoplasm Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.:Earlier in time or order.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard of five responses from much better to much worse.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Showing many obvious signs of deterioration or decline.

Concepts.definition: Showing many obvious signs of deterioration or decline.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Showing some signs of deterioration or decline.

Concepts.definition: Showing some signs of deterioration or decline.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In an unchanged or similar condition.

Concepts.definition: The status is unaltered or similar to the previous state.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
